description.narrative: The Project consists of USD 35 million loan to support the priority investment program of the Region of Fes Meknes, one of Moroccos twelve administrative regions. Proceeds of the loan will be used to fund two components: the first component related to financing COVID-19 expenditures including purchases of disinfection and sterilization equipment and the second component consists of financing regional rural roads targeting underprivileged populations in remote areas.

1.improved access to quality transport infrastructure and services: IFC expects the rehabilitation of the rural roads in the Region will expand the road network and improve accessibility to the rural communities. This is expected to benefit about 150,000 people living in rural areas from improved access to public transport and other public services, lower vehicle operations costs and timing saving. 2. Improved access to health -related products: the Project will provide funding to meet capital expenditures related to the health impact of COVID-19. This will have a direct impact on its inhabitants' health and contribute to flatten contagion of the virus. 3. Integration through mobilization of private sector financing: IFC expects that the Project will contribute towards further opening up of Morocco's subnational infrastructure financing to private investors by providing a continued strong commitment and signal for potential participants. 4. Integration through improved connectivity and mobility: IFC anticipates that the rehabilitation of the road will enhance physical connectivity and economic integration of Region to the rest of the country.
